title: Music Remixes
content:
I notice there isn't a thread on Commander Keen music remixes (anymore), so I figured I'd start one.
It could be nice to have a somewhat uniform way of informing eachother about these things.

[url=http://www.ocremix.org/]OverClocked ReMix[/url] decided to give each game its own section (1 so far), which is a bit silly in my opinion, since there aren't that many songs in the series as a whole.
For now there are 2 songs in the [url=http://www.ocremix.org/game/400/]Commander Keen 4[/url] section everybody probably already knew about.

[url=http://vgmix.com/]VGMix.com[/url] allows me to post a direct link to the [url=http://vgmix.com/search.php?game_name=Commander+Keen]Search[/url] feature using "Commander Keen" as keywords.
Since there aren't specific sections, I'll post individual links:
[url=http://vgmix.com/song_view.php?song_id=2211]Keen Commander Nostalgy '96[/url] is another old one.
[url=http://vgmix.com/song_view.php?song_id=4507]Swim Swim Eat[/url] is relatively new, the reason I posted this in the first place, and features part of the lyrics.

[url=http://www.mazedude.com/]Mazedude[/url] created a "Make it Tighter" remix called [url=http://www.mazedude.com/aa/themusic.htm]Slick Rippin Keen[/url] (track 4).

So... does anybody know of another remix site featuring decent Keen remixes?
(Especially actual remixes, reinterpretations if you will, as opposed to songs with another set of instruments and a different tempo.)
I'm sort of collecting, although I also download other games' remixes from aforementioned sites.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Music Remixes
content:
Sorry, Retodon, no idea of and other Keen Remix locations.

I just listened to 'Swim Swim Eat'. Not sure how I'll feel about it after I've listened to it 500 times, but right now I really like it. Thanks for pointing it out. The lyrics bit is cool, too.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Music Remixes
content:
Haven't heard about any others, sorry.

That 'Swim Swim Eat' was new for me too, I really liked it. Agree, the lyrics are great. Cheers![url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Swim, Swim, Hungry, Eat, Mmm...
content:
Swim Swim Eat sounds very good, and very new.A proud member of the beta testing society
[url=http://www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html]www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html[/url]

title: Re: Swim, Swim, Hungry, Eat, Mmm...
content:
Someone actually came across a new Keen mix before me. I must be slipping.

Anyway. OCR and VGMix are the only two major remix sites out there, and I highly doubt that there are any underground Keen music sites hiding somewhere. Every so often one will pop up on OCR's Works in Progress board, and I've managed to scavenge a couple from it, though they aren't as quality as the others. There's also my old banjo and fiddle one which should never be mentioned again.

title: Re: Swim, Swim, Hungry, Eat, Mmm...
content:
I found another one, a "Make it Tighter" remix, in this Dopefish.com [url=http://www.dopefish.com/ubb/ultimatebb.php?ubb=get_topic;f=1;t=000196]forum thread[/url] by eddyosaysyo.
The actual song is on [url=http://www.mazedude.com/aa/themusic.htm]this page[/url] on Mazedude's site; it's the 4th track.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Swim, Swim, Hungry, Eat, Mmm...
content: Yes, a link to the album was [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumothercommanderkeenstuff.showMessage?topicID=1175.topic]posted here a little while ago[/url].  Unfortunately the remixes in this particular album (or at least the Keen and Doom II ones I recognise) don't really seem to be remixes - they sound too much like the original songs with different instruments.  I much prefer it when the songs sound completely different, like most of the other songs in this thread.
